content.raw: From the perspective of doing an EVA to move the wheels, the setup here is reasonably realistic.  The wheels are large enough to use with a glove and the protruding handle would work well.  NASA structures do not provide as good a worksite as you might imagine.  Doing EVAs on the ISS was particularly difficult, as we had to be very careful to not damage sensitive structures, such as optical sensors and antennas.  This was especially true in the dark, as the helmet lights do not provide very wide illumination.  One of the big areas of practice in the pool was deciding what paths to take to get to the job site.  However, the mockups in the pool were not accurate with regard to the many small things in place on the ISS, so we paid a lot of attention to avoid delicate structures.
